body:
*Note: Please do not cram down my throat the benefits of building a pc, I am aware of that but the portability is a must.

Title says all, I'm moving to the states for College need a relatively powerful laptop that can run CS:GO, LoL, and being able to record minecraft by at least 60fps. 

My budget is not really infinite, but I don't really want to spend over 1000$

I live in Hong Kong, but I can order stuff online or go to local stores.

So yeah, thanks once again.
body_tagged:

title: I kinda need like a laptop or something

replies.body:
I have an i5 intel by ASUS, and it runs CS:GO with no lag, and LoL needs even less to run, so it'd run great too. Minecraft... Modpacks get a bit eh sometime, and idk about 60 fps. i7 is your best bet, and would probably be perfect.

Btw, ahat college and what state?

replies.body: Just because a computer has an i7, it doesn't mean it can run games well. A graphics card is the most important component for games. I recommendhttp://www.amazon.com/gp/aw/d/B00T7XRH2A/ref=mp_s_a_1_2?qid=1432052934&sr=8-2&pi=AC_SX200_QL40&keywo... andhttp://www.amazon.com/gp/aw/d/B00TI6TASK/ref=mp_s_a_1_11?qid=1432052934&sr=8-11&pi=AC_SX110_SY165_QL...

replies.body:
Right now, I have an Asus laptop with i7 and GeForce 745M that I got as a refurb for $700. Normally, it's at least $1100 new.

How willing are you to stretch your budget of $1000 (that is, what is the absolute maximum you would be willing to spend?)
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
I've had a lenovo laptop for as long as I can remember. They make outstanding laptops, especially for gaming. I know MSI and Asus have better GPU's in them and such.. but Tbh a GTX 860m will do great in any game even when recording at Medium to High settings.

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16834318902&nm_mc=KNC-GoogleAdwords-PC&cm_mmc=KN...

replies.body:
You and me both brotha Sho, i kinda need a new one myself, my fam is planning on saving enough for when we go to singapore for early christmas so we can buy my new laptop there cuz its cheaper than the ones they
sell here in my country (philippines), tho i have 2 options...
i either get a mac so i can get basic editing softwares for graphics like Photoshop, and iMovie, and record minecraft w/ decently high frames, and also might have extra for a wacom/drawing tablet,
or i just get like the laptop of my sister's boyfriend, he has a lenovo i7 w/ a nvidia gtx geforce (770 i think)
and hes able to run games like Assassins Creed 1 to 4, Far Cry 1 to 4, LoL, and other games and be able to
record Minecraft w/ atleast 60-100 fps, idk what do you guys think?
